# isUserInteractionEnabled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the system ignores and removes user events for this label from the event queue.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isUserInteractionEnabled: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel] inherits this property from the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] parent class. This class changes the default value of this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Related Documentation

- **isUserInteractionEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether user events are ignored and removed from the event queue.

## Accessing additional attributes

- **clipsToBounds**: A Boolean value that determines whether subviews are confined to the bounds of the view.
